meanings.definition: To make changes to something in order to improve or update it.
meanings.sent1: I will remodify the design to make it more modern.
meanings.sent2: She decided to remodify the website for better user experience.
meanings.sent3: The artist tried to remodify the painting, but it ended up looking like a mess.
meanings.sent4: He remodified his workout routine to push himself harder.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to remodify the recipe to accommodate dietary restrictions.

meanings.definition: To alter or adjust something that has already been modified.
meanings.sent1: After the feedback, I will remodify the document accordingly.
meanings.sent2: The tailor had to remodify the dress to fit the customer perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to remodify its own code, causing chaos in the system.
meanings.sent4: She had to remodify her travel plans due to unexpected weather conditions.
meanings.sent5: The architect had to remodify the blueprints to meet the client's new requirements.
